intro: Crocus gilanicus, commonly known as the Gilan crocus, is a species of flowering plant in the Iris family. It is native to the temperate regions of the Middle East and parts of southern Europe. This plant is characterized by its early blooming habit, often appearing in late autumn or early winter. Its flowers are typically pale blue to purple in color, with three petals and three sepals. The plant prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and alpine settings.
